content:
We know exactly what you tell us, nothing more. for us to investigate this issue, we will need some more information.

Could you please do the following?

  1. Open the menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information, then click Copy text to Clipboard.
  2. Go to https://pastebin.mozilla.org/, paste the clipboard by right clicking in the large text area, select paste from the menu, change the retention period to expire in 28 days, use the Paste Snippet button to create a page containing your info, then copy the resulting URL (address) of the page created.
  3. Open a reply to this post, and paste the URL to your troubleshooting information you just copied.
  4. Please also provide results for the following test on your system
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected in Thunderbird troubleshooting mode?
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected with your OS started in safe mode with Networking. Instructions for each operating system: Windows 10/11, Windows 8, Windows 7, OSX
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hi, Can you see if you are authenticating the SMTP server?

To check that: - Settings - Click on the e-mail address to open the account settings - Scroll down to the Outgoing Server (SMTP) - Click on edit - and from the window that appears ensure that the authentication method is with password or something more advanced.

Let me know if this helped.
creator: shopov.bogomil

content: Install FiltaQuilla to add Play Sound or Launch File to filter actions, then create filters for each contact, e.g. From + is + <contact email>, Action = Play Sound + <contact sound>.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Hi Wanderer, I think the functionality to move multiple folders between account types do not exists in Thunderbird. Maybe you could request one.

Please note that the POP3 folders are stored locally, but IMAP folders are stored on your IMAP server and just displayed via Thunderbird. You have to move it one by one by selecting the folder and then with right "Move to" and selecting the new location.

Have a great day!
creator: shopov.bogomil

content:
Selection of multiple folders was removed in 115, but due to user response, it might be reinstated:

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1817605

You can only transfer local mail to IMAP servers from the TB interface, but it only works with small numbers at a time:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1331879

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1400416

content: - highlight a folder and set it with all your preferred options - now, click the icon to the right of the 'quick filters' button above message view list - near the bottom of the opened menu is 'apply current view to' click that - and then click the subfolders option and then click the account name to apply the selected view to all folders in the account. - repeat above for all accounts.

content: Oops. that shows number of unread. That's not what you wanted. To see unread, - place mouse on unified tool bar and rightclick and select customize - locate the View icon and drag to unified tool bar and save - now click the View icon and select 'unread'

content:
Open the Address Book tab, right-click the Unified bar (the one with the Search box), Customize..., drag the Write button onto the bar, Save. Click the Write button to open a new message; start typing the list name in the To, Cc or Bcc box and autocomplete will suggest matches. The Write button can also be added to the main window by the same method.

If you wish to send to multiple contacts, select them in Address Book while holding the Ctrl key, then click the Write button in the other pane (next to the Event and New List buttons).

If you prefer to use the Contacts sidebar, it only appears when you press F9 in the Write window, not the main window.
creator: sfhowes
